    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard()
        Default constructor. Creates a Racetrack which is an array of Cell objects.

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard(int option)
        Constructor used for gameboards with different size.
        Parameters:
        option - to pick the size of the gameboard

    • Method Detail

      • setDebuggingMode

        public void setDebuggingMode(boolean debug)
        This method sets the debugging mode.
        Parameters:
        debug - true for test mode , false for a normal game

      • isDebugging

        public boolean isDebugging()
        This method checks the debugging status.
        Returns:
        debugging_mode false for a Normal game, true for a Test game(Debugging game)

      • testBoard

        public void testBoard()
        Testing purposes method to check the board

      • updatePositions

        public void updatePositions(Player[] p)
        This method updates the players positions on the board after a turn, it also sets a flag to check when to stop the game if a player has won
        Parameters:
        p - Player object

      • continueGame

        public java.lang.String continueGame(Player[] p)
        This method display a winning message for those who won the game by checking if the stopGame value is true
        Parameters:
        p - Player object

      • playTurn

        public java.lang.String playTurn(Player p,
                        Dice dice,
                        Deck_of_Fortune deck,
                        Wheel_of_Fortune wheel)
        Plays a turn for an individual player. Accepts all the elements/objects that are involved in the gameplay of the game. It makes the player use those objects to accomplish the movement of his or her position.
        Parameters:
        p - player that will play the turn and will use the other objects
        dice - that will be thrown by the player p
        deck - that will be used by the player p to pick cards
        wheel - that will be spinned by the player p

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
        Main Logic behind the game. Runs the game!! All the statements that could be written in the main method are written here instead.

        private java.lang.String runDebuggingGame()
